Pre-Game Insights: The UEFA Nations League is scheduled to kick off, and two teams from League B Group 2, Greece and Finland are about to lock horns.
The game will be hosted by Greece, who will play in League B for the first time, after getting promotion from the third tier in 2022.
Greece went through a devastating Euro 2024 qualifier, where Georgia shocked them.
Greece seems good to go under new coach Ivan Jovanovic.
Finland has won six of their last 10 competitive games.
Finland will enter as underdogs while facing a stronger home side.
Midfielder Dimitris Kourbelis and right-back George Baldock have been dropped from the Greece squad.
Daniel Hakans and Robert Taylor have not taken part in this international break for Finland.
Striker Marcus Forss is also out of the tie for Finland, owing to injury.
Greece and Finland have faced each other seven times in the past, with Greece and Finland winning three each, while one match ended in a draw.
Hosts Greece national football team are the favourites to win the opening tie.
Greece is predicted to win the game with ease.
Finland is expected to put up a tough fight but is predicted to lose.
